reviews.reviewTitle: Great camera, but not all accessories are necessary
reviews.reviewText:
Right up front, I am not a professional photog . . . nor can I be considered an amateur photog. I just enjoy taking pictures. I also believe customer reviews are critical. I love shopping on Amazon and I value customer reviews, tremendously. I purchased this bundle to take a step up from my Panasonic Limux digital camera. I love the Panasonic, and have been using it for a couple of years. I enjoy taking macro pictures, but recently started taking pics of birds. I wasn’t getting the quality of pictures I wanted, so a friend told me that I really needed to step up to a DSLR camera. She recommended a Nikon, but the ones she recommended were well over $1,000! Not wanting to spend a paycheck on camera (or get into trouble with my wife), I opted for the Canon Rebel T6. This is the base model, and it really is all that I need.
The reason I picked this bundle is b/c the price seemed good ($549) and it comes with a lot of accessories. After receiving the camera, I took everything out, and gave it a once-over to make sure all was good, and accounted for. The reason I give this bundle a 3-star rating is not b/c the camera is bad or cheap. I give it a 3-star rating b/c much of the bundled accessories are either not necessary for what I am doing, or the quality is not really that great.
The best parts of the bundle are: 1) camera body (obviously), 2) standard lens, 3) zoom lens (this is great for bird pics), 4) extra battery, 5) battery charger, 6) two 32GB memory cards, 7) macro lenses, and 8) the shutter remote.
The less than great parts of the bundle are: 1) the extra battery charger (I have to fiddle with it to get it in the right position so it will charge, if not it will show a green light, indicating it’s charged when it’s not), 2) the tripod (seems VERY flimsy, and almost fell over a few times when I had the camera mounted), 3) the two lens attachments (these did very little to extend the range of the lens or to magnify it for macro shots), 4) the external flash attachment (this is thin plastic and the attached guide sheet is peeling off), 5) lens filter attachments (don’t seem to make much of a positive difference in the pics I’ve taken).
All of that said, I really love this camera. I decided to spend a little extra money and get a good tripod and I upgraded the memory cards to two faster 64GB cards. If you are just getting into photography and want a great starter DSLR, I can recommend this camera. I have attached two pictures, both taken side-by-side, where I took a picture of a bird flying to the feeder. Both cameras were on tripods with the setting on action, and zoomed in to the maximum. You can immediately tell how much more clear the Canon picture is compared to the Panasonic.

reviews.reviewTitle: Inexpensive starting point with some useful extras
reviews.reviewText:
The is an okay kit, but most of the components don't match the quality of the main item: The camera.

The EOS Rebel series is a great camera line to get started, especially if you're not sure yet if you want to do photography as a professional or if you're an amateur and want to do better than "average." The APS-C (or "crop-sensor") cameras are not "full-frame," professional 35mm cameras. They have most of the features of full-frame cameras, but they are usually physically smaller, have a smaller image sensor, and generally don't have quite the image quality of the larger cameras. That doesn't mean that they're bad. In fact, they are great cameras! It just means that there is a loss of quality that, all other things being equal, can be noticed in a number of instances. However, many professional photographers use crop-sensor cameras, either as their primary camera or as a backup. Canon's EOS Rebel line of crop-sensor cameras (like the T-7i, T6, T-5i, T-6i, etc.) are designed for EF-S mount lenses, which from Canon (and a few other manufacturers) is high-quality consumer grade glass, but they also accept most Canon EF mount lenses and even some EF extensions (mostly aftermarket), so professional-quality glass can be used.

If you're looking to use this for video, I recommend looking for a T-6i or T-7i kit, since this unit can only use the built-in microphone. I didn't realize this and would have spent the money for the T-6i had I known.

The included EF-S 18-55mm IS II lens is a reliable lens with good optics for portraiture, family photos, and most other "everyday use" situations. If you want to do telephoto shots, I recommend the EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS STM lens (which is a huge improvement over the 55-250mm IS II), since there's no focal length overlap. The EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS II STM (or the newer USM) is an excellent-quality lens with a wider aperture that's also available for the EOS Rebel line, but it completely overlaps the kit lens. The 18-135mm has roughly half the maximum focal distance of the 55-250mm and is roughly twice the cost, but its overall quality is much better than either the 18-55 or the 55-250. They're all 58mm diameter glass, so the add-ons for the kit lens (like the filters and hood) are all interchangeable. I have a 55-250 and have used it with this camera kit and the quality is good enough for most amateur photographers.

As for the rest of the equipment in this bundle, the best of what you're getting are the SD cards (which are reasonably good Class 10 cards suitable for photography and light video work) , the spare batteries, and the optical filters. The card reader is superfluous with most modern PCs but might come in handy on older or low-end computers (some Macs also don't have SD-card readers). The macro and telephoto lenses, while potentially useful in limited circumstances aren't high-quality items; you'll struggle to use them much of the time even with the kit lens, and they're totally impractical for lenses beyond 110mm focal length. The included flash is ultra-simplistic, but useful if you don't already have one. The tripod is cheap plastic and will probably break fairly quickly, but again it's useful if you don't already have (or if you need to save some weight and can't put the money into carbon fiber). The lens hood may come in handy if you've got a lot of glare in one of your shots; I rarely need it but it's been nice to have when I do.

Overall, this an inexpensive way to start and it's a reasonably good value considering everything it comes with, but it's not great and much of it will leave a motivated amateur feeling wanting. Many components will end up being replaced and there will be many additions to it over time. Good for a just-starting-out middle/high school student or an amateur with limited time to practice the hobby.
Came with everything pictured, all of the add on attachments are not Canon brand but they all work and attach to the camera. So excited about this purchase! Such a great deal.

this is an AMAZING starter camera. the bundle is great, comes with 2 batteries and 2 chargers so it'll potentially never be dead, tons of lenses, and tons of other cool stuff. battery lasts a while as well. i have already taken it on 3 vacations.

I love, love, LOVE this kit! I ordered it wearily after some mixed reviews. I've always shot with nikon so this is all new for me.
I opened the camera box and was panicked thinking it was a previously used camera because I couldn't find a battery in the box. It was there, I just wasn't looking hard enough. The box was sealed and looked like a factory packed box, but I was still afraid. Before I found the battery, I called Canon tech support and discovered this third part seller (PAGING ZONE) is an authorized seller, so if I ever have a problem with the camera, the warranty is fully intact! So GOOD NEWS for me!
The reviews about the tripod were on point... The tripod is ultra lightweight and not really good for much more than table top photography... Even then, BE CAREFUL.
The wide angle lenses, was worried they sent me the wrong size, but when I attach any of the lens filters, it fits like a glove... So use a filter. As far as a review involving it breaking the lens, if it doesn't fit smoothly, don't force it. Try removing and rethreading. The only other complaint I have is the sd card reader... It is just a hair too big to fit in the usb drive. I don't know how that happens...
The flash is a little weird, but I'm still learning how to use this one....
So!
Pros:
-Camera is from an authorized seller
-All the lenses and filters fit
-SD cards and extra battery (and charger) work perfectly
-this camera takes lovely shots!
-The WI-FI transfer to phone or computer it AWESOME!

Cons:
-Cruddy tripod
-USB card reader is a hair too big to fit my USB port...

Bought it as a gift for my wife and she is thrilled both by the camera itself which is a beauty, but also by the accessories that came with it; all of them are good quality and very complete in order to form a great starter kit for an amateur photographer; great buy, you pay a fraction of the camera's price and get a bunch of great gadgets practically for free! Very pleased, highly recommended for any aspiring photographer!

reviews.reviewTitle: The camera is awsome. Did find the picture a ...

reviews.reviewTitle: STOP YOUR SEARCH! This is the best camera (and bundle) you'll find under $500.
reviews.reviewText:
I LOVE this camera! This is hands down the best camera you can buy for the price. (The Nikon 3400 is a comparable entry-level camera, and may have the edge in some aspects, but I lean toward this camera.) This is totally easy to use, especially if you've used a Canon DSLR before.

The add-ons from this seller are mostly good. Considering I paid $30 more for this whole bundle than the current retail price for JUST the body and lens, it's a fantastic value!

Pros:
- I believe this is the best camera body and lens for the money
- The Canon bag can hold everything in this bundle except for the tripod (obviously), but it is a tight fit and takes some practice to pack it efficiently.
- Having an extra battery is awesome!
- The UHS-I 32GB memory cards are actually SanDisk rather than some cheapo no name card, and each one has a capacity for thousands of full quality JPGs.
- The lens attachments and filters are ok.
- The remote shutter button is good, especially for tripod shooting to ensure the camera stays steady.

Cons:
- The tripod is subpar. It's flimsy and I worry it will fall over with the slightest bump. If you plan on using a tripod a lot, buy a different one. But for the occasional (and very careful) tripod user, this will get the job done. Again, this was part of a huge bundle for essentially $30, so I can't complain.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm a photographer and like to have a back up camera in the event ...
reviews.reviewText: I'm a photographer and like to have a back up camera in the event my primary stops working. I purchased this bundle. The tripod is extremely low quality, but I didn't expect it to be great and I didn't buy the bundle for the tripod anyway. The bag that it comes with it very small and wouldn't fit all this equipment even if you were a tetris master. I use one of my other bags for it and this one just sits in the closet. The kit lenses are meh, like any kit lens would be. The telephoto lens actually is pretty blurry and low quality, so I don't use it. The wide angle add on and the macro add on lenses however I was pretty impressed with. I also LOVE the clicker. The cord is pretty short, but it works awesome.

I am not a professional photographer, but I have loved so many of the photos that I have gotten out of this camera in the past year. I picked a Canon because I loved the macro quality I had always gotten from my little point-and-shoot elphs, and am generally more familiar with its interface. I haven't played around a ton with the extras (except perhaps for the macro lenses, which I love), but this is a wonderful grab-and-shoot camera for a beginner who wants an introduction to DSLR. The camera itself is very user-friendly, with the ability to take shots without much manual adjustment, or switch to settings where you can fine-tune to the particular situation. I've mostly used it to take nature photos, especially macro, and photos of my toddler (using the sports-action setting, it's easier to catch his antics without much blur). I'm not good at landscape at all, so I can't attest to its usefulness there, but I've never regretted buying this camera.

As far as the bundle goes, there are a couple cons: the tripod is extremely flimsy (handle broke immediately), all extras are generic (other than bag, strap, main lens, and lens cap, which actually doesn't bother me too much), and I can't seem to get the wide-angle or telephoto lenses ((Ultimaxx brand) to take a good photo without a black rim around the photo edge. It's probably the fact that I don't know exactly what I'm doing, but I don't take too many telephoto or wide-angle pictures anyway, so it's fine. There are also a few things I just don't use... The flash, the SD card reader (because my computer has an SD card slot, don't need it), remote (very, very short cord), and filters. I could see the filters being useful, though, if you know when to use them.

Bundle pros: camera bag, strap, TWO 32GB SD cards (I found quite a few kits with two 16GB cards or one 16GB with one 32GB), Canon battery and extra generic battery (again, I don't care if it's generic), Canon battery charger and generic charger (again, I don't care if it's generic, I just like having an extra!), stackable macro lenses, filters (if you know when to use them).

So, overall, I've used this camera for about a year, and absolutely love it. If you're a starter like me, I recommend getting the bundle and playing around everything to figure out what works best for the kinds of photos you want to take. You'll find out what you like, pack the handy case with stuff you'll actually use, and leave out the extras. If you know what you're doing, probably just stick with the basic camera body kit and customize the extras you need to get better quality accessories.

The camera kit alone would cost more in stores like Best Buy, Target, etc. Yet in this accessory bundle you get a bunch of extra stuff. I haven’t tried each accessory, but I reallly appreciated the two SD cards and the camera bag. As for the camera itself, I think it’s a good beginners camera for those trying to go beyond cell phone photography etc. I’ll attach some of the pictures I took during my first outings. All were taken in auto mode...I’m sure I can get better pics if I learned more about photography and used the manual settings & also purchased better lenses. However, the lens it comes with is great for general photography and to learn as a begginer. Overall im satisfied with this purchase

reviews.reviewTitle: It's great camera! Our photography teacher says its the most ...
reviews.reviewText: It's great camera! Our photography teacher says its the most complete bundle he has seen. We love it and it is working very well for our class.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and it takes great pictures.
reviews.reviewText: I love this camera. There are a ton of features and I probably need to explore them, but the auto feature is just so easy to use that I haven’t bothered learning more. The only negative thing I have found is the tripod that came in the set. It’s rather flimsy and shorter than I expected. But even with the flimsy tripod, I highly recommend this camera and accessory pack. The two dog pictures that I uploaded are some of the first pictures I took without really knowing what I was doing...great quality for just taking it out of the box.

reviews.reviewTitle: I upgraded now to benefit for the many upgrades like continuous shutter
reviews.reviewText:
I have the original Rebel for over 14 years and it took many pictures that I enlarged to 3'x4' and hung all over my house. I upgraded now to benefit for the many upgrades like continuous shutter, better indoor pictures due to better lighting technology. I collected a 300ft lens, remote shutter release and many other accessories due to my love of landscape photography.

I was surprised to find this combo kit with all the accessories that I collected and spent over $2k over the years all in this kit. This is more than a starter set, it has 90% of everything that you will need to take breathe taking pictures that every will be amaze to see. My favorite pictures are sunrise or sunsets on vacations and hang a 5"x7" in the living room to remind me of the trips. I no longer keep an album, I use the walls to display my memories that all will see. I have a 3'x4' picture of the Grand Canyon that you can see every detail and the Colorado River in the middle. If you can see it, this Rebel will take it back home with you.

The only thing in the kit that is inferior is the tripod. Mine is much better and it is worth it to invest in different one. I would not spend this amount of money to see it tip over. Everything in the kit is 5 stars so upgrade the tripod to protect your valuables.

Now I gave the original Rebel to my 21 year old daughter so she can fall in love with photography like I did at her age. It is still clicking away and have more years in it.

This is a great kit for those looking to upgrade from a crossover to a DSLR or those who used mid range film SLRs back in the day and, like me, have been waiting for years to be able to afford a DSLR.

You get everything you need to get started in both basic high quality photography and also doing those things that a crossover just *cannot* do, esp long exposures where the shutter is locked. As someone who loves night photography, light trails and painting with light, I'm in love with this camera.

All that said, this kit isn't perfect. The tripod is, simply put, total crap. I used it reluctantly, but kept a good hold on the camera the whole time. It might not be horrible as a tabletop or with the first legs extended, but plan on buying a real tripod. Likewise, the card reader is cheesy. Not really a problem, as the cable works great.

As for the case, while you can get the camera body, both lenses, both lens extensions, the flash, the filters, the shutter release and even a flexible leg mini tripod in if you are creative, you will absolutely have to move *everything* to get to *anything*. It's not too bad if you are wearing the camera and one lens around your neck, otherwise you will want a bigger bag.

These are my first pics with this camera, just messing around. None used a flash.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great camera but a lot of the accessories are not ...
reviews.reviewText: Great camera but a lot of the accessories are not canon. Extra battery wasn’t canon, neither was the extra lens.

This is an amazing deal. The camera itself cost more than this in other places so this is great because all the accesories. reviews.reviewTitle: The camera is really awesome and takes great photos
reviews.reviewText: The camera is really awesome and takes great photos, however, the included products are unfortunately pretty awful. The tripod is flimsy, the button on the remote gets stuck, the flash isn’t very good and the extra battery barely holds a charge. Might be better off purchasing the extras serpately from the camera!

All in all, this was a good buy and I am happy. The accessories are pretty low quality so don't pin your hopes on those. The camera and standard lens, however, are original Canon products and exactly as advertised. I priced this same exact camera at my local camera shop and it was the same price except the accessories did not come with it. The camera bag that comes with the package is way too small to fit all the other items and doesn't offer much protection to the camera. I am going to get a better one and use this one only in an emergency.

Don't expect the two additional lens extenders to do much because they don't. One of mine (the zoom) was defective out of the package but considering I didn't buy this package for it, wasn't too disappointed. I have messaged the seller but yet to get a response.

I most likely would buy this again and for the most part am happy with my decision.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do the research and pick the camera that fits you best.
reviews.reviewText: Tons of great videos to watch on youtube to expand your photographic knowledge and expertise. Take advantage so you can get the full benefit of having such a great camera. Tony and Chelsea Northrup do so many great video classes, so you can learn without having to do all of the reading. Take advantage of all of the resources that are available.

Its a great product it comes with everything in the picture and everything fits perfectly it comes with 2 SD cards the other one is in the camera the only bad thing is It doesn't have a flip out screen or you can't put a mic

Lots of extras lots to learn. Been along time since my 35mm Minolta so adjusting to DSLR has a bit of a learning curve. My favorite function so far is being able to link to my phone and take remote pics as well as download pics directly to my phone. There's a ton of functions I haven't played with yet, but so far it's really been worth the money. Should have got the telephoto lens 75-300 though. My 35mm Minolta had one and I could really get up on stuff. This lens isn't bad but could be better.

Very nice kit for a great price! One minor item was missing from the box, but a call to 33rd Street Camera had it sent out right away. Great customer service. The camera is pretty lightweight, which is good. I'm tired of holding a heavier camera and lens. Lots of great extras and accessories. Pretty much everything you need. It's a great deal when you can buy just the camera, one lens, and the bag for the same price elsewhere.

This is an excellent camera for starting out! I purchased it to start learning photography, and it takes beautiful photos. Per a friend’s recommendation (who is an award-winning photographer), I also purchased a Canon EF 50mm lens, so I switch between the kit lenses and the 50mm.

The added things in the kit are also really fun to play with, I especially love the macro lens! I thought I might get a lesser quality with so many added extras, but I was pleasantly surprised. I haven’t had any issues with anything so far and it’s been several months and I’ve had my camera glued to my hands since!

If you’re a beginner though, I HIGHLY suggest (nay, insist!) that you look up the meaning of aperture, ISO, and shutter speed before anything. It’ll help so much when learning your settings!

I am a little disappointed, with what I see in the photo I was under the impression that I was going to get the items that were in the photo. Now some of the items don't see durable with my camera. The tripod has already broken. Like I said I was hoping that all the products would have turned out a better quality.

I love this camera! Very easy to operate and has great pictures! READ THE MANUAL. If you don't read the manual you'll be suffering. It's a solid camera and will do what you want, be patient with yourself experimenting with settings, modes, lenses, filters. Don't be shy or embarrassed about bad photos every bad one is teaching you how to make a good one. It's digital not film so don't be afraid to screw up it doesn't cost you anything to take a picture and delete it remember don't get hung up on bad first shots you won't have time to remember them when you're taking good ones! Have fun! There's no wrong way in doing things. Just take care of your camera. It's about creativity not following instructions.
When it comes to the hardware though;
the macro/wide angle lens and telephoto lens attach to you zoom lenses. You may want to upgrade your lenses eventually after you get enough practice/delve deeper into photography but it's all good for beginners.
This bundle saves a TON of money. Get it and have fun!
I absolutely love this camera!!! Takes amazing photographs and comes with everything you need. All the accessories work great just not canon brand!

This camera is a full featured entry level DSLR - if you are a seasoned pro you'll want to go with one of the pricier models, but if you are new to DSLR cameras and are looking to step up from a point and shoot camera to something much more powerful, this is a fine first step. This camera gives you full control over most parameters of your photography, but includes a broad spectrum of presets and automation as well that lets you work your way up to using all the manual tools - if you are a beginner, this camera will carry you for a few years before you begin chafing for something a bit more substantial! The camera body is light and solidly built - all the controls are accessible via buttons on the exterior of the camera as well as through an easily navigable menu. The view screen is generous and bright, easily readable in most settings. The camera also offers a viewfinder which is very helpful when shooting in high glare settings (or when you forget to bring your glasses with you!) The included lenses cover a good range of distances, but you may want to invest in a wide angle lens - a good 12-20mm for getting more into your images (although most of the better ones out there will actually cost more than your camera did). The 75-300mm zoom lens will get you in close to many subjects, but don't expect it to compete with some of those 80x zooms you see on point and shoot cameras! Changing out lenses is easy and fast. There are ample settings for one shot, continuous shot, and timed delay shooting, so if you are shooting an active event you can get some great movement shots, and if you want to get into the picture yourself, its easy to do. When shooting in continuous mode, the camera will pause after five shots to let the data catch up - I've found that three shots is the gets keeps me from getting that delay. Both of these lenses shoot a little on the slow side. There is a slight hesitation after pressing the shutter release. I've also noticed that although the 18-55mm kit lens is equipped with an anti-shake feature, it really doesn't do much. So - consider using a tripod! The picture quality is excellent - I always shoot in RAW and this camera offers six RAW quality settings and the same for JPEG. Or you can choose to shoot both simultaneously if you don't know a lot about the formats and want to learn. Its great to have both formats to do side by side comparisons. This camera does not have an infrared sensor, so if you wish to use a remote, you'll have to use the Canon Camera Connect mobile app - it is available for both IOS and Android devices (sadly not for Windows 10 mobile devices though!). In addition to letting you control your camera remotely, the mobile apps also let you view the pictures on your camera on the bigger screens of your smartphone (I use my iPad - and its great to see a real time image for composition on that screen - believe me!) The app is pretty easy to use and so far I've found it to be stable and reliable, although more so on my iPad than on my Android phone. This camera is also capable of shooting HD movies and that is a terrific feature - but keep in mind, you'll have to master your lenses in order to stay in focus and do efficient zooms and pans. Overall this is a great camera. Canon lenses can be used on all their DSLR's, so when you are ready to upgrade to a more professional camera back, you'll be able to keep your lens kit and accessories.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seems good for what you get.
reviews.reviewText:
Camera seems ok and most of the accessories seem to be ok but the tripod and camera case are of poorer quality. The tripod is too short and not very supportive or sturdy and the camera case is barely large enough for everything. Once you FINALLY get everything to fit into the case in order to find anything or get something out you have to take just about everything out to find what you need. The case needs pukas (holes or storage pouches) on the outside so you can organize things.

I haven't taken many pictures and haven't used the extra lenses yet so I will not give any rating on those yet. If I have anything constructive to say about them later on I will add to this.

I love this camera! Takes really good quality pictures, has many different settings, and isn't too heavy! The messenger bag was a little small and definitely didn't hold all the lenses and stuff that came with this camera (I was able to borrow my dad's old bigger camera bag, which is why that wasn't a big deal for me), however the lenses themselves are amazing. The exterior flash is a little weird because it doesn't sit on top, it screws on the bottom, but it works. Also, the tripod is crap - it's very flimsy and unstable, so if that's a real must have for you, then I suggest just going ahead and ordering another tripod. Overall great product though; I'm very pleased with it!

I am all about my reviews and opinions before spending this kind of money on something (especially online) But I can honestly say I am super please with my purchase, I have had it glued to my hip since I received it yesterday! I was also reassured by a fellow photographer that this is a good starter camera and I love it so far. I have yet to play with all the accessories I read a lot of people saying they were not useful or cheap I can not give my opinion on those at this point. I know I love the camera body its self and the lenses, one of my favorite parts is I received two camera cards which is awesome because I take A LOT of pictures and hate deleting them >_< and two chargers and two batteries!!! I am very excited to take this camera out where I love to shoot and see what she can do! In my opinion its a good price especially if your just testing the waters for your first DSLR camera! I went on canon's website and they have the body and 2 lenses for $449....So for $40 bucks more you really got a good deal when breaking down everything price wise (in my opinion). Good luck!

reviews.reviewTitle: GREAT camera that makes awesome choices in fully auto settings
reviews.reviewText: GREAT camera with a great bundle. You save a lot of money with this bundle. The camera itself is LOADED with stupid proof settings. For those of you from the old school (like myself) you can use fully manual too. But the stupid shooter modes are quite excellent- not like when these fully automatics first came out. I am truly impressed with the fully automatic choices. This camera produces excellent photos on these modes. My daughter has shown me some photos from this camera and I am dumbstruck by them. So... we old timers just might be out of a job soon... lol

Nice kit & camera. The tripod is crap but i bought one from Amazon for under $30 and it works great. Now about the camera I had been using a Sony bridge camera for about eleven years and wanted something a little better. With faster fps this one has only (3) but fast enough for me. interchangeable lenses, video cable & WIFI was a surprise bonus. My only problem is reading all the crap the critics & experts say about this camera.They are too busy telling what all the camera does not have & won't do. Yes a articulating touch screen with 6 to 8 fps shooting and more focal points would be nice BUT i was not trying to spend $900 to over a thousand dollars on a camera. I saved that money and bought 2 very nice Lenses. A canon 55-250 4-5.6 & Canon EF-F Usm 18-135 3.5-5.6 Lens And I just love it. Also u soon learn get a decent camera body and buy good glass! ! !

reviews.reviewTitle: The accessories aren't with the additional cost of getting a package deal like this over just buying the body.
reviews.reviewText: When I got this I realized how badly I overpaid for the accessories. I wouldn't recommend this as a lot of the attachments are of very low quality. The camera tripod is worthless and that was one of my big reasons for going with this package over another. Most of the filters are unnecessary too and if you're buying nice lenses you don't really want to put a filter in front of them sometimes.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wish I hadn’t bought this, but I’m stuck so...
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: A lot came with this camera and it shoots beautiful pictures.

Cons: I got this for an upcoming YouTube channel because it was recommended. It’s not really user friendly and it took time to figure out its idiosyncrasies. The worst is the 32GB cards that came with it. It will only record for 12 minutes, then shut off without saving your data. You have to get a 90+ GB card which will let you record for 30 minutes. Power eats up the battery and it doesn’t have a cord that you can plug into a socket. Calling Canon wasn’t helpful at all.

If I had to do it again, I wouldn’t have bought this camera....

reviews.reviewTitle: The camera is pretty nice but it takes some getting used to
reviews.reviewText: The camera is pretty nice but it takes some getting used to. Most of the stuff that came with the camera is cheap and useless, particularly the stand (flimsy and lopsided) and the additional lenses. The cannon branded items are all nice. The sd cards and converter have worked wonderfully. It is worth buying this particular package compared to others because you get both of the cannon lenses, which are really nice.

You could buy the camera body, the lens you need, and some better quality accessories for less than or about the same cost.

Great camera, bag, and canon lenses.
Some of the accessories were cheap and not useful for serious use.
Tripod is cheap aluminum and can break easy
Macro lens screw on extensions are not useful.
Camera flash is brighter than additional flash attachment.
Lens hood is more complicated than it should be. Just get a canon branded lens hood.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice camera. I'm a beginner with DSLR
reviews.reviewText: Nice camera. I'm a beginner with DSLR. So I got this and am I impressed. I bought a EF 70-300 to go along with it. I'm learning quite a bit. There's a lot more to learn but it's exciting to see the results. I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for more than a good starter! Also Paging Zone is great dealer. Shipping was prompt even though it wasn't Prime. Package was great. Okay the tripod was cheap!!!! But the rest of it was all good quality. I bought 2 cameras from them and pleased with both deals. When I upgrade I'll definitely buy from them again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Camera is great but some accessories could be better.
reviews.reviewText: Tripod is very flimsy (but compact if concerned about carrying in a small form factor with your gear), hot flash appears cheaper in design than I am use to using, the canon bag is small (will fit everything minus the camera body with small lens attached and the tripod so if you want to carry everything order a DSLR designed-use backpack), second battery was a viviparous brand and not Canon (but same design so not really important on what name is on the battery). Other than these few issues I am happy with the kit!

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing camera I got it two days after I made ...
reviews.reviewText:
Amazing camera
I got it two days after I made the purchase.Came with everything shown on the pictures & everything was very well organized shows great pride of ownership from this company.Camera was easy to set up and there's also a bunch of YouTube videos that help you out in case u have any questions , I've lived in the NYC for 17 years and have taken The city from granted now that I have this great camera it motivates me to go sign seeing and start visiting museums parks and landmarks , Deft recommend buying this

First off- know NOTHING about photography. I just wanted to take better pictures when we travel. Right out the box I took some pics using some of the presets that came out great. It captures details that a smartphone just can’t capture. I used the 18-55 lens that was provided in the bundle. As I got more comfortable I started playing with the shutter speed, flash, ISO, etc. If you are a novice such as I am, do a little research as to what the functions do for your pics. I am very pleased with this camera and am glad I bought it. I look forward to the pics I will take with it as I get to know the camera better.

I bought this as a birthday present for someone who is trying to get back into photography. There's a lot of accessories that comes with this bundle, so I doubt the person I'm gifting this to will use all of it, but it's good that they have that option. Instead of a SanDisk memory card, I received a Sony memory card. No biggie since the speed of both brands are about the same (Song reads it a bit faster). I hope my giftee enjoys this present

reviews.reviewTitle: I really love the camera it takes high quality photos and all ...
reviews.reviewText: I really love the camera it takes high quality photos and all the other accessories where perfect except for the tripod. The tripod was all plastic and it felt like my camera was going to fall.. But overall the product is amazing

My niece has taken some very impressive pictures with this camera. I hope she gets into this as a hobby (or beyond). This is a great kit to start with and even build on. Lenses you buy today for this model can be used with other Canon DLSR's.

I got soooo much photo credit off of this camera. I am so grateful that this camera has captured so many beautiful moments. I'm a beginner but this camera makes me feel advanced. It can take pictures fast too!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's an amazing value for starters and has alot of things I ...
reviews.reviewText: It's an amazing value for starters and has alot of things I didn't think about. The wide lens and telescopic lens including filters we're things I would have never got. The tripod is crap though and really only good for light weight things like a smart phone mount or lighting. Otherwise the other components were great and we'll worth the value.

Excellent value for the money. In the store, I'd have spent the same for just the camera body, and that much more on the lenses. The tripod is so lightweight as to be useless in normal use, but it's okay if you just need to set the camera up about 12". What's lacking is a bit more documentation of what's what. Oh ... the bag ... as other reviews have suggested, it's 'way too small: I will end up getting a back-pack style bag ... this one hold the camera and one lense, and not much more. But to get me started, this is terrific.

reviews.reviewTitle: Is a nice camera, but the accessories doesn't work with the ...
reviews.reviewText: Is a nice camera, but the accessories doesn't work with the size of the lens, for example the lens hood is not from the right size What can i do?

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor Customer service, products in bundle to not work with camera
reviews.reviewText: Camera bundle is a great deal. Customer service response is not as satisfactory. I used the tripod in the bundle on flat ground, and without even being fully extended it was not able to hold up the camera, which resulted in it tipping over and cracking one of the lens. When I contacted the seller to ask about the warranty I was ignored and never received any response. This purchase was a well researched and expensive one, and I would have hoped for more professional customer service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Eh.... maybe youll have better luck than me?
reviews.reviewText: The tripod came with a dented leg and a broken clip. The telephoto lenses cap is on so tight it won't come off for use. The camera box looked like it had been previously opened. The longer lense came in its own box, the seal was already cut. So I'm thinking they sent me a returned item. All the extras were cool, but not worth it for potentially getting a returned camera.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality camera that's easy to use
reviews.reviewText: We wanted to invest in a high quality camera and are very happy we chose this one. It takes great photos and is easy to use for beginners. It also has a lot of settings for those with more experience. The bundle was nice - it came with a lot of different lens and things we experimented with and the camera bag is actually pretty nice too. The tripod is awesome and can get really tall as well. I definitely recommend this camera if you are inexperienced like us but want a good quality camera to take photos with. This was great for our Europe trip!

It is going to take a long time to figure out all of the features on this camera. I really did like the complete array of accessories that came with this package. In particular I bought this package because it include a car charger. I do most of my photography out in the field so I can easily keep one battery charged up while the other is in the camera. I agree with other reviewers that the main tripod, especially at full extension, may be a bit shaky to put a $400+ camera on. However at its more compact settings it should be OK. The included carry bag will definitely not hold camera, both lenses, and all the other "stuff" included. Camera and lenses will fit, but will need another bag if you want to carry all the items at once. Cant wait until the weather clears up and I can give it a true workout....

It's easy to use, but I wouldn't recommend it to beginners. Only to beginners that plan on taking up photography as a major hobby, just because it is such an investment. I was happy with the camera and the different lenses and things the camera came with, and it came with plenty.

It's not a typical point and shoot and there are setting and ways to manipulate the camera. If you aren't planning on spending some time behind the camera, then save your money and get a simpler camera. It is easy to use and download pictures and things like that.

The camera is great and works fine, but as expected the bundle is not so good. The one real lens is great, but the 'macro' and 2x lens does not work so well. The filters are filters and work as filters do. The tripod is shaky and the lens hood is cheap. Besides that, the case, camera, main lens, batteries, chargers, strap and the SD cards work just fine. I still find it a great deal due to the SD cards, lens and case for a fairly low price. The flash works, but it seems it doesn't perform much better than the built-in flash.

reviews.reviewTitle: Go for a package that has two lenses.
reviews.reviewText:
For the price of the camera, the only true Canon items were the camera itself, the 18/55mm lens, the camera strap, one of the battery chargers, and the camera bag.
The only decent 3rd party items included are the extra battery, battery charger, and the ultra SD cards. Everything else is junk. It would be an insult to your photos to even bother using the “lenses” they supply. You’re better off getting a deal with the 18/55mm lens and possibly a telephoto lens (70/200mm). Look elsewhere if you want a better deal. Overall, shipping was fast and everything included that it lists was there. Canon DSLR cameras are very good- no matter if you are a beginner or a veteran photographer. Quality is great. I absolutely love the wifi/bluetooth capability to transfer images directly to my phone and even remotely snap photos using the canon camera app.

Awesome starter camera! Three stars is because most of the goodies are either near-worthless dollar-store quality or aren’t even compatible with the camera (only the longer zoom lens is Canon). The tripod broke after simply extending it, the spare battery doesn’t charge in the Canon charger (I’m afraid to put it in the camera), the uv filter, macro lenses, and 2.2x telephoto lens are all totally incompatible, and the flash is a piece of garbage.
Get this camera, but get a different setup or buy what you need separately.

reviews.reviewTitle: this camera has been amazing. I love learning about all the settings to ...
reviews.reviewText: So far, this camera has been amazing. I love learning about all the settings to mess with and figure out which I like best. I am not a professional by any means but I do feel like this camera helps me feel more like one! I will be taking our family photos with it for sure. The photos I have taken so far turn out so crystal clear. I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Besides the camera being Very Good - loved all those accessories that came with it.
reviews.reviewText: Really good camera and I used almost all of the extras that came with it. With all those accessories that came with the camera it really was the best deal around, and I looked !! Also, Except for the tripod that was at least usable, all the accessories were Brand name and Top Notch.

It comes with everything it says it will. I just wanted a camera to record my sons games. This does the trick. I also ordered the 55-200 IS lens for 140 later cuz the zoom camera the bundle comes with shakes during video without image stabilization.

I havent used the tripod...yet. The smaller lens is that..very small. The zoom lens is great, sans it not having IS.

The extra batter IS in the box..its hidden under a flap. I thought i didnt get it.

Ita packed very welll. The extra wide angle lens is fantastic. Im still getting used to this camera. My 1st dslr.

I am an entry level photographer. The Rebel line of cameras was recommended to me by a good friend. I have gotten out to get a few shots with this camera and its kit lens and I am really pleased with what I am getting from this camera.

I am still learning all the things I can do with this kit and I have ordered a Canon EF-S 55-250mm F4-5.6 IS STM Lens for Canon SLR Cameras (Certified Refurbished) and the Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 STM Standard Prime Lens.

I am looking forward to seeing what I can do with them.

As far as the other parts of the kit go, the tripod is plastic and feels flimsy. Invest in a decent one.
The Wired Shutter Release Remote does not seem all that good either. Invest in a decent one.
But the fact that you get 2 batteries and 2 SD cards was one of the reasons I got this kit.

I am already out of Auto and using manual with this kit and I am very happy with the picture quality.

My opinion is that if you are looking to get beyond a point and shoot or want to get someone a good entry level camera then you should get this for them or yourself.

I am very happy with this camera. It takes excellent photos, battery life is good, it is simple enough for a novice photographer to use well.
My only complaint about the camera is that it can sometimes have a processing delay in between photos while using a high resolution. It is only noticable when taking photos on wick succession.
Regarding the accessories: some of the items are great (extra battery, car charger, some of the lens attachments), but some are very cheap. The tripod is very flimsy, though functional enough. This is a small issue and I still consider this package a great buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: There are so many cameras that you should invest in, but this isn't one.
reviews.reviewText:
The camera itself has a lot of features that are DSLR essential, yet absent in this one. The lens works great. The teleconverters are visible in the corners of the photos. The flash is overwhelmingly too bright. The SDHC cards have a surprisingly low read speed, and are not the ones in the picture. The SD card reader is not the one pictured either, but it is the same brand and model and such. The tripod was the biggest disappointment. After less than 12 hours of extremely(!!!) light use, the handle to adjust the camera on the tripod has broken off like butter. The metal used for it is extremely weak, and it was already dented and scratched straight out of the packaging.

I would recommend this camera to anyone who would be using it for family photos and trips, but not anyone looking for videography use. There is no mic input for Pete's sake! If you do buy this bundle, make sure you buy your own tripod, because this one is a piece of junk! Probably gonna end up in the trash by tomorrow.

I Purchased this camera for myself as a Christmas gift and I absolutely love it! I have been searching since November and hoping for a good black Friday deal but found nothing that compared to this particular item on Amazon that includes all the accessories. It’s a fantastic camera and I am very happy with the purchase. I recommend anyone who is considering photography as a hobby to purchase this item. It has everything you will absolutely need and the price is great!

reviews.reviewTitle: a great deal for this kit
reviews.reviewText: I was so excited when I opened my package and saw everything it came with. For sure, a great deal for this kit. Unfortunately the extra battery and car charger I received were not compatible with each other, nor the camera and original Cannon battery it came with. Now I have to send it back and pay for rush shipping in order to have it for a trip I'm taking. Not ideal. This is a huge inconvenience. Let's hope the next one I order has the right accessories!

reviews.reviewTitle: Finally tried out this camera with the 1 lens that actually fit and all the photos are blurry and look really bad. I spent the extra money because I thought ...
reviews.reviewText: Only one of the camera lenses is made for the Canon camera, the other lenses do not fit at all and are basically paperweights. Finally tried out this camera with the 1 lens that actually fit and all the photos are blurry and look really bad. I spent the extra money because I thought this was an actual Canon camera with Canon accessories, but this is not the case. I would like to return all these items, it was a waste of money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Be sure you will use all of the accessories
reviews.reviewText: camera is great and wi fi feature made it great to share my vacation photos. The extra battery wouldn't charge in my canon charger and it's a little bigger than the factory battery so it was a little snug in the camera and had to be pried out. One of the filters distorted my shots on the zoom lens, but without it the shots were great. I still have to try all of the accessories, but am pleased with the camera. Looking back I probably could have done without some of them. I wish the camera had a feature where you can crop and save an image like my old Nikon, but there are enough ways to do that afterward

My daughter is taking a digital media arts program at school. This is exactly what the teacher told her to get. He was blown away by the price! It came fast and she loves it!! She saved up her own money to buy this and is so proud to have gotten such a great deal!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the camera! One of the accessories are a little cheap.
reviews.reviewText: This camera is easy with lots of room for grown as a semi-newbie. It's takes beautiful, sharp images and I'm very happy with it! The accessories are cheaply made... most specifically the strap and tripod. I bought a different strap and rarely use the tri pod though.

Great DSLR camera for beginners. This deal comes with an almost overwhelming amount attachments and accessories. The camera itself is easy to get the hang of and ease its operation. The price for value is more than worth it. All in all, worth the purchase and any wait period. My only complaint is the carrying case that comes with it isn't spacious enough to carry all the items pictured. So you'll either have to purchase a larger bag or not carry everything at once. Which, in some situations, won't be a hassle because you may not need everything.

reviews.reviewTitle: it's a great bundle for beginning photographers
reviews.reviewText: Keep in mind that there's a ton of stuff in here that you probably won't need. That being said, it's a great bundle for beginning photographers, especially if you're not quite sure what kind of photography you want to do yet. If you have a little more experience, or if you're willing to research what each piece of equipment does, I'd recommend just figuring out which pieces you would need. Chances are good that you can everything you would actually use separately for a better price.

I love this camera. It does everything but write your name, and I guess it would do that if I only knew how to program it. There is only one problem, my hard drive in my computer died and I cannot retrieve any of the pictures that I downloaded. Boo hoo, because we had to say goodbye to our beloved pet and we cannot look at her pictures anymore. We took the computer to Best Buy and they say that they can retrieve our pictures , maybe, for $80.00.

reviews.reviewTitle: The camera works very nicely. Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: The camera works very nicely. Easy to use, easy to manipulate. The accessories that come in this package are not "Cannon" brand. Cheaply built plastic junk. Some of the filters won't even stay on the lenses for outdoor use. Thought I was purchasing all Cannon parts with the kit.
So much came with this bundle!!!! To much to put in bag if your not a fan of keeping boxes but you get everutjing pictured. And its heavy, not cheap plastic light feeling items.

A good entry level Camera for those serious about getting into photography. There is a little of a learning curve if you have never used any camera other then the camera in your phone. It's pretty easy to use and takes excellent quality photos for the price range and a major perk is that any of the EF lenses you buy for this camera will be fully usable on any new Canon camera later.

great! Got the package and everything fits/ are included.

I eventually found my extra battery in the camera box under the cardboard bottom!

bought this kit because of a photography class and needed something quick and inexpensive (this) + prime!

(in more a PC than a camera person)

the tripod is bad, don't expect much from it

the extra flash is cool on my opinion

and at least they include memory cards

Time to buy some tempered glass for the screen and I should be set

I got this camera as a “something better than my iPhone, but nothing too complicated.” The bundle pack seems worth the value. As a beginner, I honestly don’t know how much of the accessories I will use at this point. I took this camera on a two week trip and the pictures turned out fantastic. They downloaded to my phone easily with the Canon app. It would have been helpful if there were instructions or anything to teach me how to use the features. I had to rely on google and YouTube to figure out what buttons did what, how to send images to my phone, and the basics of taking good pictures.

reviews.reviewTitle: This bundle was the most abundant and generous collection we found--hands down the best deal ever
reviews.reviewText: Early Christmas gift for hubby. This bundle was the most abundant and generous collection we found--hands down the best deal ever! It arrived packaged well and on time. Hubby now has all the lenses, filters, zooms, and accessories any professional photographer would have in their cache! Very, very pleased with the Canon line of products.

The camera is a lot heavier than I expected and when I did research I didn’t realize it wasn’t touchscreen or a flip out screen so I’m really bummed and the WiFi capability is not at all what I expected because when it says you can share instantly that’s not true you have to send it to the app and then from the app you have to save it to your phone so there are a lot of steps before your able to share the picture.

This camera is very good for landscape pictures. Portrait pictures are just okay, not wonderful. I was very disappointed
in the close up use of this camera. It really is not good for close up pictures. I take pictures of items I put on Ebay. When
I tried to take close ups with this camera the results were not acceptable. There is a decided clunk when you take pictures.
This noise could be a little softer. It sounds like you are dropping a wrench on a concrete floor. Ker-chunk.

I upgraded from a T3 to this T6. Nice to not have to go through another learning curve. My old T3 battery still holds a better charge than the new one. Not very impressed with the lens adaptors. I do like having an extra battery and memory card. I have not used the external flash yet. Looks promising for bounce flash applications. Overall I am happy with this T6.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just get it, it’ll give you a reason to go explore the world.
reviews.reviewText: This is a great package deal. Everything you need to start. I bought this for my wife for a gift. She loves it! The picture quality is amazing. Even as a beginner she is capturing some beautiful images. It’s a nice setup for the aspiring photographer, or even the accomplished artist.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best bang for your buck DSLR Bundle!
reviews.reviewText:
The Canon EOS Rebel T6 is a great start for new photographers.
I chose this DSLR as my first ever DSLR and this bundle were worth every single Penny.
Everything described on the page was given.
Though some items were not good and felt very bad, many were good. The SD cards and the polarizers were very useful and good. I even like shooting with the Macro Lenses included from Vivitar.
The extra battery included is Vivitar and not Canon, but it still is very useful in case my other battery runs out.

Overall this bundle was a great deal and I will enjoy using the t6 and the many other items in this bundle in the future!

reviews.reviewTitle: Guess they got their $700 but would have like some sort of call
reviews.reviewText: Product had a defect on the digital screen internally where BUSY showed as BuSY and some numbers that were in the same places as the u were not showing as full number leading to believe something was wrong with the section where the U was. Contacted the seller, showed no concerns. Guess they got their $700 but would have like some sort of call. Takes nice pictures though but bad customer service.

Update:The camera stopped working and the batteries will no longer charge.

The accessories that came with the camera are not very well made. The tripod was far too flimsy and couldn't even hold the weight of the camera, causing it to fall and luckily the lens cap was on or else it could have broken it.

I love this kit. Got this for my wife and I as a starter camera. She’s been wanting a dslr for ages and I’ve been thinking of starting a YouTube channel so I fingered what the hell.
I wish I did more research though while this is a great camera be careful if your wanting to use an external microphone as this model will not let you. For that you would have to get the T6i or better. Still for entry level I can’t complain and it’s been fun to learn with.
So exciting opening this box of goodies!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: First of all the camera didn't come with a lense like shown in the pictures or told with the descrition
reviews.reviewText: It was missing some of the things that were supposed to come with it. First of all the camera didn't come with a lense like shown in the pictures or told with the descrition, yes it came with the two other lenses but the camera itself didn't. Also, it says it comes with a back up camera battery but the camera itself doesn't come with one and it shows in the pictures that it'll come with two. Last what really got me upset is that it said that you would get 2 SD cards of 32 GB and I didn't even get the SD cards so now I have to hold off taking pictures until I buy some SD cards separately. It was a good bundle until I didn't receive a lot of the things mentioned in the description!!

reviews.reviewTitle: A ton of accessories at a good price
reviews.reviewText: I did a lot of research for cameras and packages, this one seemed to be fairly priced and came with everything needed to get started. Still learning how to use it and all the extras it came with. Takes good pictures. The lens isn't great for distance, so might recommend something with a better zoom for those taking outdoor photos.

I bought this camera bundle, not knowing what to expect. I was expecting there to be some issues, (i.e. generic parts, missing parts, non-working parts) but had no problems whatsoever. Order arrived on time, contained EXACTLY what is pictured, everything works nicely, overall an amazing photographer's bundle! Yes, there are some non-Canon brand parts included, but all are usable with this camera. I highly recommend this camera to ANYONE that is looking for a great starter bundle.

We bought this for our daughter’s 16th birthday. This camera was well worth the price! We took her to New York for her 16th birthday and this camera came in handy. She took tons of pictures and the quality is great! The camera bundle is the best way to go!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great camera for a good price
reviews.reviewText: The gadgets are cheap but everything fits and works fine aside from the tripod it’s very flimsy wouldn’t recommend using it with the camera itself it won’t hold however everything else came fine and the camera it’s great for beginners! Great purchase honestly for the price

reviews.reviewTitle: When I found this pack I thought it was too good to be true
reviews.reviewText:
Always been a fan of Canon Rebel. When I found this pack I thought it was too good to be true. Honestly I have used almost everything in this pack. It's well worth the money.

I would recommend getting a second or just a larger camera bag as the one that comes with it only holds the camera and lenses comfortably.
GREAT camera set! I really do wish I knew a little more. Didn't realize that the T6 records HD video, but doesn't have a mic jack. Other than that, awesome!

I love this Camera. Omg, it really worth.
Just one of the chargers doesn't work.

I bought this for my wife for Christmas and she loves it! I really like it as well. I use a Nikon at work occasionally and this camera is much lighter and I think it takes better pictures. We haven't even had a chance to use all the goodies it comes with! The picture shown was taken at Bass Pro with this camera.

reviews.reviewTitle: Check your package well when received!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this package a year ago and have taken many awesome pictures on the many vacations this past year. Unfortunately I was having an isssue with my Cannon EF 75-300mm lens recently. The local camera shop told us that the lens was not communicating with the camera and it would cost more to repair than purchase new. So, looking to purchase another lens I found that our lens says EF-S 55-250 mm not what was advertised and not what the box states, EF 75-300mm. I thought I did a better inventory check, but I didn’t. The photos I took were great, so no complaints there, but it did break in less than a years use and they sent a lens that was wrong. Lesson learned, always check your package is what was advertised!

Love my new Canon EOS Rebel T6 😊 Now need to find more time to get out and play with it. I'm just an amateur photographer but what I have and with it pictures have turned out beautiful. A photographer friend recommended this camera because the ease-of-use and I'm not disappointed.

Used all semester for my photography class, and now to take pictures. I just took my roommates engagement photos.

Easy to learn, and it takes great pictures. I'm still learning new things about this camera that make my pictures even better, though!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great starter bundle at a great price.
reviews.reviewText: This is a great bundle and a bargain for everything that is included with it. The only real flaws I see in this bundle are the very flimsy, aluminum tripod that I've already dented and the secondary flash does seem pretty cheap as well. These are things that I will be upgrading in the future. It's a great starter bundle for amateur photographers or hobbyists.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the Best Cameras at the Price.
reviews.reviewText: Great camera bundle at a great price. Camera is more competent than most photographers. Many features are used too seldom to be remembered by occasional users. Works very well in automatic modes which makes it a great camera for beginners as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome Camera... Flash sent with bundle does not match camera.
reviews.reviewText: I love the bundle. The camera is awesome. However, as someone mention previously, the external flash sent with the bundle does not match the camera. So, be prepared to purchase your own. The camera has a flash on it but if you want more light; you have to purchase your own external flash.

I love this camera! I am not a professional photographer by any means so this is perfect for me and my newfound hobby. It came quicker than I expected. It was missing a few things but the seller responded quickly and I received them just a few days after.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great camera, but go easy with some of the accessories.
reviews.reviewText:
Great Camera and accessories. The pictures we've taken so far have been outstanding for a camera of this prices and type. The 18-55 mm lens has been sufficient for our needs so far, but I can see us using the 75-300 mm at some point too. The car charger has been unexpectedly useful as well.

Word of caution on the Vivitar wide angle lens bundled with this camera. The Canon lens is mechanical. It's driven by plastic gears inside the lens and these are very delicate. They're small and built for a very specific function. When you add on the Wide angle or any other lens to the Canon lens, you're adding more weight to the lens and the gear is stressed beyond it's design. We added on the clear filter to the lens to protect it from dust, moisture and scratches.. but those are lightweight so we're ok with it.

It is capable of many different functions and configurations so for two people who have zero experience using a camera of this type we struggled. It does come with a manual but it is similar in size to a pocket dictionary and isnt practical when you need the information but dont have a half hour to spend searching through it. The only other complaint we have is the size of the Cannon bag that comes with it. Dont get me wrong its great quality but considering how many accessories that come with the camera its difficult to get everything into it. Lots of trial and error to make everything fit and if you happen to need something and its in the bottom of the bag ultimately your gonna have to take almost everything out to get it which again isnt very practical and inconveniant if your on the go. That being said we still think its a good buy as it takes great pictures and does come with just about everything you need for one price rather than buying everything seperately.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Canon EOS T6 takes very nice pictures at 18MP and there are a bunch of ...
reviews.reviewText:
The camera: The Canon EOS T6 takes very nice pictures at 18MP and there are a bunch of settings to ensure that a novice can get the subject in focus and at right exposure under a variety of conditions. It also can be used in full manual mode (lenses have a switch for auto- or manual-focus). Having owned Canon cameras recently, I was little surprised at how long it took me to figure out the menus, but now that I've practiced with it I fell more comfortable changing settings quickly.
The package: The accessories are really for the first-time user, as I would imagine most experienced photographers would have a tripod and flash, both of which are pretty cheap in this package. The extra battery is a must and the home and car chargers are a nice addition. By far the best accessory here is the 0.43x wide-angle adapter, which screws onto the 18-55mm zoom lens to give a nice wide view which is great for small rooms and garden shots. Naturally, there's some vignetting at the widest setting. The bag holds the camera and both lenses, along with one of the lens attachments (there's also a 2x multiplier), but not much else. Plan on bringing the chargers and filters in a separate bag. The package also contains two 32GB flash cards. Battery life is excellent.

reviews.reviewText: I Think this camera is great although I am still learning how to use its many functions. Came with 2 SD Cards, 2 batteries and chargers. The Vivatar flash works great once I learned how to use it with the on camera flash. I don't really have any use for the close-up filters at this time. I used a film based SLR many years ago, but switched to small point and shoot cameras for vacation trips since I was tired of lugging the thing around. The pocket cameras allowed me to get many photos I would have never taken since I would have left the larger camera behind. Now I use both, but the Canon quality is so much better, versatile and consistent than the pockets cams.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Bundle, but a few things to note.
reviews.reviewText: Of all of the things that come in the bundle, a few things should be addressed. When using the tripod, your camera will just barely sit unevenly, due to the lack of support on the one side. The only use for the SD card reader would be if you didn't have an SD card slot to insert it in, which is almost always comes factory with anything that also has a ISB port. Finally, the slave flash isn't compatible with this camera. Ive tried different methods of using it, but after some research, I found that this external flash will never work with the T6 Rebel. Other than that, it was a great deal!

reviews.reviewTitle: BUY THIS CAMERA, but expect to purchase a bigger bag, and a much better tripod.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this camera for work, and upon initial inspection, everything was basically as expected. Two caveats right away:

1) The camera bag is tiny. It's going to fit your camera with standard lens on, your long distance lens, and a few accessories in the front pocket. There are no side pockets, and there isn't a pocket in the roof of the bag. This might be an ideal bag for a tiny day shoot, but if you want flexibility, you're going to want a bigger bag - I was fully expecting to get the larger cannon bag that had all the pockets and double the width.

2) The tripod is super flimsy. In fact, I removed the shoe for the tripod and wasn't able to get it to screw back on. It's like there was a part there that flew off when I separated the shoe from the tripod, and I didn't see it fly. If there was such a piece, No idea where it went. If there wasn't such a piece, then this tripod is broken before I ever put a camera on it (which is why we try these things out!). In addition, it only makes it to about 4' high fully extended. If you're going to spend a bunch of time sitting while taking pictures, it might be ideal, but it's too ergonomically incorrect to slave over for hours for that perfect shot. In addition, your shoe really should be something that you can screw onto your camera, and then snap into the base. Anything else is just playing with matches.

I was looking to get into photography and this camera from Canon looked like a good starter camera to get into DLSR photography. I have never owned a camera other than my smartphone camera and was up and running taking pictures in a few minutes. Very easy to use in auto mode and just started to explore the manual modes. Lots of good videos on the tube to guide you through. I did purchase the 50mm lens after watching a few videos and it’s great for portrait shots. If you new to photography then give this unit a try.

I have not had this long, but here is a general 'first' impression... First who every put this bundle together should have be required to pack (safely) everything in the included bag.

The camera bag does hold the camera and two lens just fine, with a little room in the camera section. and has a pocket on the side that the flap covers when it's closed. I just used another camera bag I had for storing some of the other items.

The Flash include is a cheap one, no way to adjust where the flash it pointing w/o moving the entire flash. But it does work, and includes a bracket to side mount the flash to the camera.

The tripod is light, probably too light, I'll keep it in a vehicle as a spare in case I forget to take one of my better tripods.

As far as to the lens, really have not had time to give them a proper run though. I am coming from a Panasonic DMC-FZ18, so I feel I need more time to learn how to properly work and use a dSLR.

Anyway that is some of my thoughts about this bundle, good for the price but could have been somewhat better.

I would give this a 5/5 if it was just the camera. The camera and lens it's self is great. However, some of the extra things that come with it are a little cheap. In the pictures it makes it look like the accessories are canon products but they are not they just fit canon equipment. The only thing I received that was canon was the lens, camera, strap for camera and a battery charger that ended up not working.

Don't get me wrong, I didn't really care because I am a beginner and was just excited about all the stuff you get "free" in the bundle. The accessories work well and fit just not brand name.

If you are trying a beginner this is an excellent product, of course since I purchased this last year I paid a little more, so at this price it is totally worth it.

Also what sold me was the ability to connect the camera to my smart phone via wifi and instantly upload photos. So EASY! Also you can print them straight from camera.
